classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as l-alpha-amino acids. These are alpha amino acids which have the L-configuration of the alpha-carbon atom.

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Pyridoxamine kinase
polypeptide.specific-function: Phosphorylates B6 vitamers; functions in a salvage pathway. Uses pyridoxamine, but has negligible activity toward pyridoxal and pyridoxine as substrates.

polypeptide.name: Poly(A) polymerase alpha
polypeptide.specific-function: Polymerase that creates the 3'-poly(A) tail of mRNA's. Also required for the endoribonucleolytic cleavage reaction at some polyadenylation sites. May acquire specificity through interaction with a cleavage and polyadenylation specificity factor (CPSF) at its C-terminus.

go-classifier.description: termination of RNA polymerase II transcription
transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Chorismate mutase AroH
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the Claisen rearrangement of chorismate to prephenate. Probably involved in the aromatic amino acid biosynthesis.

go-classifier.description: aromatic amino acid family biosynthetic process

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Glutathione reductase, mitochondrial
polypeptide.specific-function: Maintains high levels of reduced glutathione in the cytosol.

go-classifier.description: transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter

target.name: S-ribosylhomocysteine lyase
target.organism: Deinococcus radiodurans (strain ATCC 13939 / DSM 20539 / JCM 16871 / LMG 4051 / NBRC 15346 / NCIMB 9279 / R1 / VKM B-1422)

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: S-ribosylhomocysteine lyase
polypeptide.specific-function: Involved in the synthesis of autoinducer 2 (AI-2) which is secreted by bacteria and is used to communicate both the cell density and the metabolic potential of the environment. The regulation of gene expression in response to changes in cell density is called quorum sensing. Catalyzes the transformation of S-ribosylhomocysteine (RHC) to homocysteine (HC) and 4,5-dihydroxy-2,3-pentadione (DPD).
polypeptide.organism: Deinococcus radiodurans (strain ATCC 13939 / DSM 20539 / JCM 16871 / LMG 4051 / NBRC 15346 / NCIMB 9279 / R1 / VKM B-1422)

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Carboxymethylenebutenolidase
polypeptide.specific-function: Ring cleavage of cyclic ester dienelactone to produce maleylacetate.

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Dimethyl sulfoxide/trimethylamine N-oxide reductase
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes the reduction of dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) and trimethylamine N-oxide (TMAO) to dimethyl sulfide (DMS) and trimethylamine, respectively. The terminal DMSO reductase can also use various sulfoxides and N-oxide compounds as terminal electron acceptor in addition to DMSO and TMAO.

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Peroxiredoxin-2
polypeptide.specific-function: Involved in redox regulation of the cell. Reduces peroxides with reducing equivalents provided through the thioredoxin system. It is not able to receive electrons from glutaredoxin. May play an important role in eliminating peroxides generated during metabolism. Might participate in the signaling cascades of growth factors and tumor necrosis factor-alpha by regulating the intracellular concentrations of H(2)O(2).

go-classifier.description: negative regulation of extrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway in absence of ligand
negative regulation of lipopolysaccharide-mediated signaling pathway
negative regulation of NF-kappaB transcription factor activity
negative regulation of reactive oxygen species metabolic process
negative regulation of T cell differentiation
regulation of hydrogen peroxide metabolic process
respiratory burst involved in inflammatory response
transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter

polypeptide.name: Peptide deformylase
polypeptide.specific-function: Removes the formyl group from the N-terminal Met of newly synthesized proteins. Requires at least a dipeptide for an efficient rate of reaction. N-terminal L-methionine is a prerequisite for activity but the enzyme has broad specificity at other positions.

polypeptide.name: Malonamidase E2
polypeptide.general-function: Carbon-nitrogen ligase activity, with glutamine as amido-n-donor

go-classifier.description: carbon-nitrogen ligase activity, with glutamine as amido-N-donor

polypeptide.name: Fatty acid-binding protein, adipocyte
polypeptide.specific-function: Lipid transport protein in adipocytes. Binds both long chain fatty acids and retinoic acid. Delivers long-chain fatty acids and retinoic acid to their cognate receptors in the nucleus (By similarity).

go-classifier.description: negative regulation of protein kinase activity
